document.title: Health Education Content Standards for California Public Schools, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve

F9765080DFE30131925568A86D17958E.description: Skills for this content area are not identified until grades seven and eight.

F975EBF0DFE30131925468A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

F9758B00DFE30131925368A86D17958E.description: Describe ways people can protect themselves against serious bloodborne communicable diseases.

F9751CF0DFE30131925268A86D17958E.description: Engage in behaviors that promote healthy growth and development during puberty

F974CD00DFE30131925168A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

F9748460DFE30131925068A86D17958E.description: Develop plans to maintain personal hygiene during puberty.

F9741670DFE30131924F68A86D17958E.description: Identify steps to achieve and maintain a healthy and accurate body image.

F973C1B0DFE30131924E68A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

F9737EB0DFE30131924D68A86D17958E.description: Analyze why it is safe to be a friend to someone who is living with HIV or AIDS.

F9733B40DFE30131924C68A86D17958E.description: Describe the importance of identifying personal boundaries.

F972F630DFE30131924B68A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

F972B010DFE30131924A68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate refusal skills to protect personal boundaries.

F9726550DFE30131924968A86D17958E.description: Use healthy and respectful ways to express friendship, attraction, and affection.

F97210B0DFE30131924868A86D17958E.description: Use effective communication skills to discuss with parents, guardians, and other trusted adults the changes that occur during puberty.

F971BE50DFE30131924768A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

F9716EE0DFE30131924668A86D17958E.description: Differentiate between reliable and unreliable sources of information about puberty.

F9711690DFE30131924568A86D17958E.description: Recognize parents, guardians, and other trusted adults as resources for information about puberty.

F970CF70DFE30131924468A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9708700DFE30131924368A86D17958E.description: Discuss how changes during puberty affect thoughts, emotions, and behaviors.

F9703320DFE30131924268A86D17958E.description: Describe how heredity influences growth and development.

F96FE4B0DFE30131924168A86D17958E.description: Explain how culture, media, and other factors influence perceptions about body image, gender roles, and attractiveness.

F96F7D10DFE30131924068A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F96F2A20DFE30131923F68A86D17958E.description: Identify personal hygiene practices and health and safety issues related to puberty (e.g., showering, use of sanitary products, deodorant, and athletic supporters).

F96EE330DFE30131923E68A86D17958E.description: Explain that puberty and physical development can vary considerably and still be normal.

F96E8D30DFE30131923D68A86D17958E.description: Recognize that friendship, attraction, and affection can be expressed in different ways.

F96E4A30DFE30131923C68A86D17958E.description: Recognize that everyone has the right to establish personal boundaries.

F96E0570DFE30131923B68A86D17958E.description: Recognize that there are individual differences in growth and development, physical appearance, and gender roles.

F96DC010DFE30131923A68A86D17958E.description: Describe how HIV is and is not transmitted.

F96D7660DFE30131923968A86D17958E.description: Define sexually transmitted diseases (STDs), including human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) and acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS).

F96D27C0DFE30131923868A86D17958E.description: Identify the physical, social, and emotional changes that occur during puberty.

F96CD2A0DFE30131923768A86D17958E.description: Explain the structure, function, and major parts of the human reproductive system.

F96C82F0DFE30131923668A86D17958E.description: Describe the human cycle of reproduction, birth, growth, aging, and death.

F96C3490DFE30131923568A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

F96BA290DFE30131923368A86D17958E.description: Encourage others to minimize pollution in the environment.

F96B5B30DFE30131923268A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

F96B0A20DFE30131923168A86D17958E.description: Practice strategies to protect against the harmful effects of the sun.

F96AC790DFE30131923068A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate personal responsibility for health habits.

F96A8400DFE30131922F68A86D17958E.description: Practice good personal and dental hygiene.

F96A3C10DFE30131922E68A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

F969F300DFE30131922D68A86D17958E.description: Monitor progress toward a personal health goal.

F969AA10DFE30131922C68A86D17958E.description: Monitor progress toward a goal to help protect the environment.

F9696260DFE30131922B68A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

F9690A10DFE30131922A68A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to determine when medical assistance is needed.

F968C930DFE30131922968A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to determine personal choices that promote personal, environmental, and community health.

F9688620DFE30131922868A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

F96844C0DFE30131922768A86D17958E.description: Practice effective communication skills to seek help for health-related problems or emergencies.

F9680060DFE30131922668A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

F967B830DFE30131922568A86D17958E.description: Identify individuals who can assist with health-related issues and potentially life-threatening health conditions (e.g., asthma episodes or seizures).

F96763B0DFE30131922468A86D17958E.description: Identify sources of valid information about personal health products and services.

F966F950DFE30131922368A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9669F10DFE30131922268A86D17958E.description: Identify internal and external influences that affect personal health practices.

F9665710DFE30131922168A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9661000DFE30131922068A86D17958E.description: Explain that all individuals have a responsibility to protect and preserve the environment.

F965C920DFE30131921F68A86D17958E.description: Define life-threatening situations (e.g., heart attacks, asthma attacks, poisonings).

F9657F50DFE30131921E68A86D17958E.description: Describe the personal hygiene needs associated with the onset of puberty.

F96531F0DFE30131921D68A86D17958E.description: Describe how environmental conditions affect personal health.

F964EC50DFE30131921C68A86D17958E.description: Explain how viruses and bacteria affect the immune system and impact health.

F964A1C0DFE30131921B68A86D17958E.description: Identify effective personal health strategies that reduce illness and injury (e.g., adequate sleep, ergonomics, sun safety, handwashing, hearing protection, and toothbrushing and tooth flossing).

F9645320DFE30131921A68A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

F963B0D0DFE30131921868A86D17958E.description: Encourage and promote healthy eating and increased physical activity opportunities at school and in the community.

F9636350DFE30131921768A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

F9631EE0DFE30131921668A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to assess personal physical activity levels.

F962D9C0DFE30131921568A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to balance food intake and physical activity.

F9629140DFE30131921468A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate how to prepare a healthy meal or snack using sanitary food preparation and storage practices.

F96249D0DFE30131921368A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to choose healthy snacks based on current research-based guidelines.

F961FD60DFE30131921268A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

F961AEC0DFE30131921168A86D17958E.description: Monitor personal progress toward a physical activity goal.

F96169A0DFE30131921068A86D17958E.description: Monitor personal progress toward a nutritional goal.

F9612510DFE30131920F68A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

F960DF90DFE30131920E68A86D17958E.description: Compare personal eating and physical activity patterns with current age-appropriate guidelines.

F9609980DFE30131920D68A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to determine activities that increase physical fitness.

F9604DC0DFE30131920C68A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to identify healthy foods for meals and snacks.

F95FEF00DFE30131920B68A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

F95F9A60DFE30131920A68A86D17958E.description: Use communication skills to deal effectively with influences from peers and media regarding food choices and physical activity.

F95F4180DFE30131920968A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

F95EEEA0DFE30131920868A86D17958E.description: Interpret information provided on food labels.

F95E8240DFE30131920768A86D17958E.description: Locate age-appropriate guidelines for eating and physical activity.

F95E30B0DFE30131920668A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F95DEE20DFE30131920568A86D17958E.description: Describe the influence of advertising and marketing techniques on food and beverage choices.

F95DADD0DFE30131920468A86D17958E.description: Recognize that family and cultural influences affect food choices.

F95D6CC0DFE30131920368A86D17958E.description: Describe internal and external influences that affect food choices and physical activity.

F95D2940DFE30131920268A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F95CE4F0DFE30131920168A86D17958E.description: Identify physical, academic, mental, and social benefits of regular physical activity.

F95C8B60DFE30131920068A86D17958E.description: Describe how physical activity, rest, and sleep are related.

F95C45F0DFE3013191FF68A86D17958E.description: Explain how good health is influenced by healthy eating and being physically active.

F95C0010DFE3013191FE68A86D17958E.description: Describe the benefits of eating a nutritionally balanced diet consistent with current research-based dietary guidelines.

F95BBB40DFE3013191FD68A86D17958E.description: Explain the concept of eating in moderation.

F95B7070DFE3013191FC68A86D17958E.description: Differentiate between more-nutritious and less-nutritious beverages and snacks.

F95B11C0DFE3013191FB68A86D17958E.description: Describe safe food handling and preparation practices.

F95AAC80DFE3013191FA68A86D17958E.description: Explain why some food groups have a greater number of recommended portions than other food groups.

F95A6100DFE3013191F968A86D17958E.description: Explain the relationship between the intake of nutrients and metabolism.

F95A1310DFE3013191F868A86D17958E.description: Identify key components of the "Nutrition Facts" labels.

F959C5D0DFE3013191F768A86D17958E.description: Describe the food groups, including recommended portions to eat from each food group.

F95977A0DFE3013191F668A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.
